title: Lind
text:
Lind is a surname of both <a href="Swedish%20language">Swedish</a> and <a href="Estonia">Estonian</a> origin. In <a href="Swedish%20language">Swedish</a>, it is the word for the <a href="Tilia">linden</a> tree. In <a href="Estonian%20language">Estonian</a>, it is the word for bird.
Geographical distribution.
As of 2014, 36.1% of all known bearers of the surname "Lind" were residents of the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> (frequency 1:17,107), 26.2% of <a href="Sweden">Sweden</a> (1:644), 8.0% of <a href="Germany">Germany</a> (1:17,143), 7.7% of <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a> (1:1,255), 3.9% of <a href="Norway">Norway</a> (1:2,278), 3.1% of <a href="Finland">Finland</a> (1:3,054), 2.3% of <a href="Canada">Canada</a> (1:27,037), 2.0% of <a href="Australia">Australia</a> (1:20,530), 1.5% of <a href="Estonia">Estonia</a> (1:1,539) and 1.4% of <a href="Austria">Austria</a> (1:10,630).
As of 1 January 2021, 369 men and 407 women have the surname Lind in <a href="Estonia">Estonia</a>. Lind is 112th most common surname for men in Estonia, and the 112th most common surname for women. The surname Lind is most commonly found in <a href="Hiiu%20County">Hiiu County</a>, where there 17.86 per 10,000 inhabitants of the county bear the surname.
